description: Unique identifier for a column customization record within a table layout.
Technical field name in the target data table that this customization controls.
Identifier of the table or grid this customization applies to, including module or context.
Display order of the column within the grid or form.
User-facing header caption shown for the column.
Free-form configuration value for column behavior or formatting; format varies by implementation; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether the column is shown to users.
User account that created the customization record.
Timestamp when the customization was created.
User account that last modified the customization.
Timestamp of the most recent modification.
Indicates if the column’s values are not editable in the UI.
Identifier for the parent customization set/profile this column belongs to; likely 0 means default or global configuration; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether a value is mandatory when entering or updating records for this column.
Name of the lookup/list source used to populate selectable values for the column; confirm binding rules.
Preferred display width of the column in pixels.
Maximum rendered height for this column’s cells or rows, in pixels; likely used for multi-line fields; confirm with SME.
Flag controlling whether the column appears in printed or exported reports; confirm accepted values.
JSON-encoded advanced settings for the column, such as formatting, validation, or conditional visibility.
For date/time fields, indicates whether the time component should be displayed; confirm applicability.
Maximum permitted value or length for the column, depending on data type; confirm exact rule.
